Package me.efekos.simpler.items

Class ItemContent

java.lang.Object
net.md_5.bungee.api.chat.hover.content.Content
me.efekos.simpler.items.ItemContent
@Deprecated public class ItemContent extends net.md_5.bungee.api.chat.hover.content.Content
Deprecated.
This class is moved into another repository, and will be removed from here soon.
Used to show items in chat. To use this class, you must have an ItemStack to get content for it. How this works is: Simply it replicates everything inside an ItemStack to something Minecraft would understand. When you use this content with HoverEvent(HoverEvent.Action, Content...), it gets this content as an item NBT data. This is why most of the item showers use NMS, because they need an exact same copy of the items nbt data, which seems like accessible only using nms. But with this class, you can show most of the normal items in game. from(ItemStack) copies all the data inside ItemStack to itself exactly, however some display names might be lost at the items inside a shulker box, even with the fact that their names get saved too. Some extreme items (like a ban shulker or a cursed bundle) have a small chance to make some lag in the server, maybe, just maybe, even crash it. IMPORTANT: Be aware that this class is intended to be used in 1.20.2 servers.

  • Constructor Details

    • ItemContent

      public ItemContent(String id, Integer count, ItemTag tag)
      Deprecated.
      Constructs an ItemContent without a slot. Since Slot is only important for contents that will be in under shulker box content, you can use this constructor for other cases.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the item. Recommended: NamespacedKey.getNamespace()+':'+NamespacedKey.getKey().
      count - Amount of the item. Recommended: ItemStack.getAmount().
      tag - Actual data about the item. Recommended: ItemTag(Integer, Integer, me.efekos.simpler.items.compound.Display, boolean, Integer, EnchantmentCompound[], Integer) or from(ItemStack) if you don't want to struggle constructing a Tag.

    • ItemContent

      public ItemContent(String id, Integer count, ItemTag tag, Integer slot)
      Deprecated.
      Constructs an ItemContent with the data given.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the item. Recommended: NamespacedKey.getNamespace()+':'+NamespacedKey.getKey().
      count - Amount of the item. Recommended: ItemStack.getAmount().
      tag - Actual data about the item. Recommended: ItemTag(Integer, Integer, me.efekos.simpler.items.compound.Display, boolean, Integer, EnchantmentCompound[], Integer) or from(ItemStack, Integer) if you don't want to struggle constructing an ItemTag.
      slot - Slot of the item. Only important if this content will be under a shulker box content.

    • from

      public static ItemContent from(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack stack)
      Deprecated.
      Generates an ItemContent usable in HoverEvent(HoverEvent.Action, Content...) for the ItemStack given.
      Parameters:
      stack - Any ItemStack you want.
      Returns:
      An almost exact copy of the NBT data about the item. Can be used mainly in HoverEvent(HoverEvent.Action, Content...).

    • from

      public static ItemContent from(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack stack, @Nullable Integer slot)
      Deprecated.
      Generates an ItemContent usable in HoverEvent(HoverEvent.Action, Content...) for the ItemStack given. But instead of from(ItemStack), this also add a "Slot" value. It is something important for content inside shulker boxes.
      Parameters:
      stack - Any ItemStack you want.
      slot - Value you want to put in "Slot".
      Returns:
      An almost exact copy of the NBT data about the item. Can be used mainly in HoverEvent(HoverEvent.Action, Content...).

    • clearTagString

      public static String clearTagString(String tagString)
      Deprecated.
      Removes default values from the tag string. Example: At {"text":"hi","bold":false}, "bold":false is useless because texts are not bold by default. This method removes it from the tag.
      Parameters:
      tagString - String version of a Tag.
      Returns:
      Filtered version of the tag given.

    • calculateDecimalColor

      public static Integer calculateDecimalColor(org.bukkit.Color color)
      Deprecated.
      Converts a Color to a decimal color, a color format used for leather armors and fireworks in Minecraft.
      Parameters:
      color - Any Color
      Returns:
      An Integer for the color given, found using this formula: (Red << 16) + (Green << 8) + Blue.
